text: you can deploy docker containers from a
private repository to AWS elastic
Beanstalk in a few simple steps first
use docker login from your workstation
to sign into the private docker registry
you can skip this step if you've already
signed in second find the docker CFG
file that the dr. CLI created when you
logged in this is usually in your home
directory third sign into the Amazon s3
management console create a new s3
bucket or use an existing one and upload
your dr CFG file to the bucket
you
be sure to choose the option to encrypt
the file on the server-side fourth
create a docker run AWS JSON file that
points to the private repository and
image you want to deploy your container
from add an authentication member that
includes the s3 bucket and key that you
just uploaded your doctor CFG file to
finally create an I am role that has get
access to the file you just uploaded
here I'll use the policy generator to
help me build a minimal policy
you
in the elastic Beanstalk management
console I click create new application
choose docker and upload the doctor run
a double US JSON file except most
defaults but be sure to choose the
instance profile or I am role you just
created in a few minutes elastic
Beanstalk has deployed my container and
I can use it
